schemaOrRef.description: Schema fragment or reference describing the shape of an I/O payload.

ioSource.description: Declarative source of an input payload so the compiler can reconstruct the dependency graph.

phase.description: Name of the phase that produces the referenced output port.

port.description: Name of the output port within the producing phase.

path.description: JSON Pointer (or dot path) pointing to the data within the source envelope.

exposes_as.description: Optional alias for wiring this output into other systems (e.g. exported return value).

persistence.description: Directive describing where to persist the phase output; path_template must include {phase} and {output}.

securityClassification.description: Standardised data handling tier for phase inputs and outputs.

algorithm.description: Hashing algorithm identifier such as sha256.

value.description: Hex-encoded digest of the persisted artifact.

canonical_source.description: URI or path indicating where the digest was computed.

verification_schedule.description: Frequency or trigger for re-validating stored artifacts.

phase.description: Name of the phase executed by this node. Defaults to the node id when omitted.

condition.description: Expression or natural-language condition evaluated by this node.

until.description: Termination condition for loop nodes (expressed as natural language or DSL).

body.description: Entry node executed for each loop iteration.

max_iterations.description: Optional safety bound on loop iterations.

condition.description: Guard or exit expression evaluated for this iteration.

expected_transition.description: Identifier of the node or state that must be reached when the condition is satisfied.

deterministic.description: Indicates whether the transition is provably deterministic under documented constraints.

max_iterations.description: Bound on iterations permitted while this condition remains true.

evidence_uri.description: Reference to formal validation evidence supporting this transition.

loop_node.description: Control-flow node identifier for the loop under validation.

validation_owner.description: Accountable role responsible for maintaining deterministic loop behaviour.

linked_phase.description: Optional reference to the phase predominantly executed while in this state.

guard.description: Predicate or condition required to fire the transition.

trigger.description: Event or output driving the transition.

enforced_phase.description: Phase that must successfully complete to satisfy this transition.

persistence.description: Directive describing final output persistence with placeholders {output} and optional {timestamp}.

source.description: Reference to the compiler module that emitted this artifact.

determinism_proof.description: Summary of evidence demonstrating reproducible IR generation.

target.description: Identifier of the node, phase, or tool this budget governs.

description: Extends the mini-program schema with enforced on-disk persistence for all LLM outputs, standardising tmp/.save storage, while retaining provenance, fairness, anomaly, and compliance guardrails. Adds stateful tool contracts, modular compiler interfaces, automated governance policy diffs, signed audit chains, fallback tool matrices, adaptive risk trigger calibration workflows, compliance evidence export APIs, dataset license conformance maps, behavior drift early warning signals, release rollback rehearsal metadata, and onboarding compliance checklists. Introduces decentralized audit trail integrations, continuous learning guardrails, auto-generated prompt diff reports, autonomous tool revocation workflows, cross-border data transfer registries, ethical review board decision logs capturing minority opinions, adaptive prompt throttling policies, provenance integrity verification workflows, continuous governance KPI dashboards, automated tool safety certification checklists, privacy risk heatmaps, alignment incident postmortems, guardrail hypothesis tracking records, phased model cards, incident response simulation reports, runtime feature flag governance profiles, continuous access review workflows, and adaptive risk appetite configurations. Augments this release with privacy-preserving logging profiles, runtime guardrail versioning manifests, risk propagation mappings, synthetic trace replay scenarios, human-review skill matrices, LLM output data quality contracts, continuous data quality backtesting profiles, zero-knowledge guardrail attestations, real-time safety observer channels, dependency license audit manifests, LLM consent receipts, and scenario outcome confidence profiles. Further extends governance with continuous resilience testing schedules, LLM safety case documentation, multi-model consensus policies, real-time explanation traces, LLM audit log signing policies, and data subject request handling workflows. Expands this release with LLM prompt grounding evidence registries, governance metric alert subscriptions, policy change impact forecasts, context expiration policies, toolchain dependency retirement plans, and LLM model pairing guidelines. Adds automated compliance mapping diff reports, LLM tool latency budgets, incident postmortem templates, safety test evidence manifests, adversarial training dataset descriptors, and human override authorization workflows.
